sentence.Network_en: She may embarrass you with her uncouth behavior.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的粗野行为可能会让你尴尬.

sentence.Network_en: To a Japanese, spilling anything is uncouth.
sentence.Network_cn: 对日本人来说, 泼溅任何东西都是不文明的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 松松：3天背完GRE难词 ... sordid:adj. 肮脏 20。 uncouth:adj. 笨拙的, 粗俗的, 不舒适的 22。 riveting:adj. 迷人的 23。.
新编大学英语单词表(第三册) - 豆丁网 ... transaction n. 事务，交易 uncouth a. 无教养的，粗鲁的 visible a. 明显的，看得见的.
The Chinese disciples of Pareto might have thought him uncouth ., 巴莱托的中国门徒们也许要嫌他粗鲁的吧.
土字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 土气〖 soilvapor〗 土气〖 countrified;rustic;uncouth;vulgar〗 土墙〖 cobwall〗.

list.abs: A man considered uncouth or mean ; a boor ., 被认为粗鲁的或卑鄙的人 ; 举止粗鲁的人.
A man considered uncouth or mean ; a boor ., 被认为粗鲁的或卑鄙的人 ; 举止粗鲁的人.

He is a selfish , uncouth fellow , who has no respect for anyone ., 他是个自私 , 没教养的家伙 , 对人一点也不尊重.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English uncūth 'unknown', from un- 'not' + cūth (past participle of cunnan 'know, be able')

entry.def: If you describe a person as uncouth, you mean that their behaviour is rude, noisy, and unpleasant.

means.word_mean: 1. lacking refinement or cultivation or taste;

sentences.sentence: "he had coarse manners but a first-rate mind"
"appealing to the vulgar taste for violence"
"the vulgar display of the newly rich"
